title: Indoor Rock Climbing Mechanics Exploration: Developing Physical Regulation Skills via Ecological Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic physical coordination skills and experience in solving simple problems
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based video analysis combined with field practice. Emphasizes communication and documentation during rock climbing, integrated with language subjects.

learning_goals: Learners can recognize and explain 3+ body composition patterns (arm-leg coordination, weight distribution, foot placement angles)
Learners can develop over 30% new coordination methods compared to their existing movement repertoire after 6 weeks of training
Learners can document problem situations encountered during rock climbing in verbal/video form and discuss solutions with peers

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
